00070    class MTRand_int32
00071    {
00072    public:
00073 
00077       MTRand_int32();
00078 
00082       MTRand_int32(unsigned long s);
00083 
00087       MTRand_int32(const unsigned long* array, int size);
00088 
00092       MTRand_int32(const MTRand_int32&);
00093 
00097       void operator=(const MTRand_int32&);
00098 
00105       virtual ~MTRand_int32() {} // destructor
00106 
00110       void seed(unsigned long);
00111 
00115       void seed(const unsigned long*, int size);
00116 
00120       unsigned long operator()();
00121 
00125       template <class Archive>
00126       void serialize(Archive& ar, const unsigned int version);
00127 
00128    protected:
00129 
00130       unsigned long rand_int32(); // generate 32 bit random integer
00131 
00132    private:
00133 
00134       static const int n = 624, m = 397; // compile time constants
00135 
00136       // The state array and variable p were static members in the C++
00137       // port by J. Bedaux. Made non-static by David Morse, Dec. 2011
00138 
00139       // state vector array
00140       unsigned long state[n];
00141 
00142       // position in state array
00143       int  p;
00144 
00145       // true if init function is called
00146       bool init;
00147 
00148       // Used by gen_state()
00149       unsigned long twiddle(unsigned long, unsigned long);
00150 
00151       // Generate new state
00152       void gen_state();
00153 
00154    };
00155 
00156    // Inline methods.
00157 
00158    inline
00159    unsigned long MTRand_int32::twiddle(unsigned long u, unsigned long v)
00160    {
00161       return (((u & 0x80000000UL) | (v & 0x7FFFFFFFUL)) >> 1)
00162         ^ ((v & 1UL) ? 0x9908B0DFUL : 0x0UL);
00163    }
00164 
00165    /*
00166    * Generate 32 bit random int, private method.
00167    */
00168    inline unsigned long MTRand_int32::rand_int32()
00169    {
00170       if (p == n) gen_state(); // new state vector needed
00171       // gen_state() is split off to be non-inline, because it is only called 
00172       // once in every 624 calls and otherwise irand() would become too big 
00173       // to get inlined
00174       unsigned long x = state[p++];
00175       x ^= (x >> 11);
00176       x ^= (x << 7) & 0x9D2C5680UL;
00177       x ^= (x << 15) & 0xEFC60000UL;
00178       return x ^ (x >> 18);
00179    }
00180 
00184    inline unsigned long MTRand_int32::operator()() { return rand_int32(); }
00185 
00189    class MTRand : public MTRand_int32
00190    {
00191    public:
00192 
00193       MTRand() : MTRand_int32() {}
00194 
00195       MTRand(unsigned long seed) : MTRand_int32(seed) {}
00196 
00197       MTRand(const unsigned long* seed, int size) : MTRand_int32(seed, size) {}
00198 
00199       MTRand(const MTRand_int32& other) : MTRand_int32(other) {}
00200 
00201       ~MTRand() {}
00202 
00203       double operator()()
00204       {  return static_cast<double>(rand_int32()) * (1. / 4294967296.); }
00205       // divided by 2^32
00206 
00207    //private:
00208 
00209       //MTRand(const MTRand&); // copy constructor not defined
00210       //void operator=(const MTRand&); // assignment operator not defined
00211 
00212    };
00213 
00217    class MTRand_closed : public MTRand_int32
00218    {
00219    public:
00220 
00221       MTRand_closed()
00222        : MTRand_int32()
00223       {}
00224 
00225       MTRand_closed(unsigned long seed)
00226        : MTRand_int32(seed)
00227       {}
00228 
00229       MTRand_closed(const unsigned long* seed, int size)
00230        : MTRand_int32(seed, size)
00231       {}
00232 
00233       ~MTRand_closed() {}
00234 
00235       double operator()()
00236       {
00237         return static_cast<double>(rand_int32()) * (1. / 4294967295.); }
00238         // divided by 2^32 - 1
00239 
00240    //private:
00241 
00242       //MTRand_closed(const MTRand_closed&); // copy constructor not defined
00243 
00244       //void operator=(const MTRand_closed&); // assignment operator not defined
00245    };
00246 
00250    class MTRand_open : public MTRand_int32
00251    {
00252 
00253    public:
00254 
00255       MTRand_open()
00256        : MTRand_int32()
00257       {}
00258 
00259       MTRand_open(unsigned long seed)
00260        : MTRand_int32(seed)
00261       {}
00262 
00263       MTRand_open(const unsigned long* seed, int size)
00264        : MTRand_int32(seed, size)
00265       {}
00266 
00267       ~MTRand_open() {}
00268 
00269       double operator()()
00270       {
00271         return (static_cast<double>(rand_int32()) + .5)*(1./4294967296.);
00272         // divided by 2^32
00273       }
00274 
00275    //private:
00276       //MTRand_open(const MTRand_open&); // copy constructor not defined
00277       //void operator=(const MTRand_open&); // assignment operator not defined
00278    };

00283    class MTRand53 : public MTRand_int32
00284    {
00285    public:
00286 
00287       MTRand53()
00288        : MTRand_int32()
00289       {}
00290 
00291       MTRand53(unsigned long seed)
00292        : MTRand_int32(seed)
00293       {}
00294 
00295       MTRand53(const unsigned long* seed, int size)
00296        : MTRand_int32(seed, size)
00297       {}
00298 
00299       ~MTRand53() {}
00300       double operator()()
00301       {
00302         return (static_cast<double>(rand_int32() >> 5) * 67108864. +
00303           static_cast<double>(rand_int32() >> 6)) * (1. / 9007199254740992.);
00304       }
00305 
00306    //private:
00307 
00308       //MTRand53(const MTRand53&); // copy constructor not defined
00309       //void operator=(const MTRand53&); // assignment operator not defined
00310 
00311    };
